comment: honestly she really isn't all that bad she's a pretty average professor. There is weekly quizzes and three projects for the course i took. as long as you do the work you should pass, all assignments are online. She is not bad but there is better professors for this course.
Attendance not required but highly encouraged. GO TO TUTORING it helps. good luck if you weren't born a computer science prodigy.
Overall, the class isn't bad just be prepared for a lot of studying and learning on your own time.
Kendrick is super nice and does her best to help her students, just do the work and listen in class and you'll be fine

what it explains does not appear in the exams. Is a difficult class. Lots of jobs and assignments. You hardly have time to do homework and study. If you request a system regrade he tells you isn't needed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: You can tell that she really cares about what she teaches and she truly cares for her students and their well being. She is so understanding. Theres a lot of reading that is frequently beyond the scope of the class/quizzes. She uses real world examples to explain CS concepts which is perfect for absolute beginners. If you're not, skip this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Kaleigh Kendrick is a great instructor. She was responsive to emails and her review sessions were recorded and really helped when it came time to take exams. The department as a whole is terrible. The tests are not made by her and they often had mistakes. She could improve content by being more independent and providing more content that she makes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: Teacher does not care about her students nor does she provide good material to study.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: she is a solid choice for 1321. her reviews are very helpful. She'll ask on a forum to put stuff you feel confident or struggling in and address the major points the class wants to know. You're class is taught by a variety people but she is by far the most helpful as in answering our questions.
She's very nice and pretty easy to talk to. Secondly, never miss her live session if you really want to pass any of the Exams/Test in this class.

Worst class I have ever taken. First off all it is impossible to contact this professor. I haver tried throughout the semester every single way and she never responds to a single one of my emails. She literally throws you into the fire when it comes to coding and the instructions are extremely unclear with everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Test heavy class, doesnt really teach most of the assignments, but refers to websites for you to learn in your own. Not fun, lots of confusing code she just throws us websites for, and overall just not a great experience online.

Prof Kendrick is very nice and pretty easy to talk to outside of class. She does an office hour review before major tests, they're a must. It is not necessarily an easy course but if you put the effort in she'll do everything she can to help.

I took CSE1300 as an online asynchronous class in Fall 2020. Professor K is great and I'm so glad I took her for my first CSE class. She really cares about her students, she is patient and helpful and I learned a lot. Weekly readings, lectures, zybooks, and open-note quizzes. Optional weekly reviews to go over module content and ask questions.

Be prepared to teach yourself. I was new to coding and spent a lottime in the tutoring center than I should have. She's nice, but the lectures are not helpful, does not review the material well, and barely shows you how to code. Quizzes are based on videos and Ted Talks.
I generally felt she was rude and condescending anytime I communicated with her. The few lectures she did do were not as helpful as just watching youtube videos on the material.

Professor K is a delight. The FYE (CSE 1321/L and CSE 1322/L) is a mess, but prof K tries her hardest to help her students. She would always tell us before tests what topics to study! This class, regardless of what professor you take, has a lot of self-teaching, so brace yourself if you are new to coding. Be prepared for LockDown Browser!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: If you have no programming knowledge whatsoever be prepared to make tutoring sessions to help with your projects, she will even advertise that herself. If you took this class to learn how to code, good luck doing that on your own. Textbook was a joke, quizzes were over YouTube videos. She claims the curriculum will be different next semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Everything was online and every question you asked you were literally just directed to the best practices website or with no actual feedback or input given, or you were told to just go and make an appointment with a tutor. She only wanted you to pester her as a last resource. Be prepared to teach yourself. Nice lady. Not helpful.

Professor K is a great teacher. I took her class during 2020 Spring semester, I hate that the pandemic caused the class to move online. She is very caring and wants everyone to understand the material. She helped me understand a certain topic when I went to her office hours. She's very strict on test days! Take this teacher if you can!

We use zyBooks for busywork, something similar to ALEKS. You are not taught anything through her online class, if you don't pick up information reading from your weekly 40+ page assignment or going through zyBooks, oh well I hope you learn something in the next CSE class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Very good professor. She is very caring and genuinely cares about each student and their progress in the class.

I am really glad that my first programming class was with Prof K. She takes the time to make sure her students understand the material and she uses multiple different teaching tactics to facilitate explaining the more difficult concepts.

Took this class spring 2019. Worst part of the class was that we had to choose our group for the 2 group projects on the first day. The class was a bit difficult for me as I had never done any sort of coding before, but the mandatory homework, zybooks, was so helpful & there's lot of practice material. Lectures are ok. Doesn't let excuses slide.

Horrible. Taught us how to print words in python then asked us to generate a code that will write a song. Moved the midterm up by a week and only mentioned it in passing in class. Went against her own syllabus to mark students down a grade. I got a C but she insisted that in her calculations were two decimals points lower. Avoid at all costs.

WORST professor Ive ever had. She treats adults like 3rd graders and doesn't even teach the things that are on her projects. I shouldn't have to make 6 tutoring sessions or spend the whole night browsing google for things she didn't teach. Easy class, but be prepared to pull your hair out because its just non stop, pointless busy work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Whole course is graded on four exams and a quiz average. Regarding exam guidelines and the way certain things are taught: the computer science department grades exams as a group, and there are many things that they tie her hands on. Despite this, she finds whatever way she can to work around these limitations. One of the best professors I've had.

She gives great lectures and seems to truly care for students; class is optional for extra credit. She can often get mad at students for not participating even if nobody truly gets it. She likes to help but also wants you to solve problems on your own, so in class questions can easily be turned back around at you instead of getting help.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Kendrick is pretty solid overall. The tests and department are a disaster though. Nearly every test had mistakes. The course and lab are taught be different instructors, which can cause the schedules to get out of sync. So be prepared to teach yourself how to code if this happens! Prof K does her best to help though!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She is okay, she acts like we know everything already and when we ask her to explain something she doesn't do it very well. There are a handful of indiv and group projects. There is an online textbook but there is hw due on there but isn't too time consuming. She does attendance on an app where you have to be in the building to check in.

shes amazing, she can teach. the cse program is kind of a mess but kendrick is amazing and gives you coded up examples in pseudocode and source code when the class is only pseudocode. overall the class is 3 tests and 1 final, study the old exams and youll be good but pay attention in class and email her whenever needed. attendance is extra credit

I took Kendrick for 1300 last semester (Spring 2019). 1300 is an intro class that focuses on computing history and computer parts, with programming coming later on. We learned HTML/CSS, and then did Python (this was before Python was removed). Online work was tedious, but otherwise I enjoyed the class. Kendrick is kind and cares about her students.

Professor Kendrick is amazing and I wish so badly they would put her on 1322 for next semester. Great lectures, full of useful info and tips, very knowledgeable, super helpful, replies fast to emails, very reasonable grader, there for her students, provides live coding examples and tons of her own coded examples. Shes amazing, please take her!

Everyone takes the same quizzes & exams, so difficulty level is just based on the course itself. She's a good professor, has a positive attitude, and she listens to student input. It's a good idea to put in work outside of class. Attendance is extra credit.

Her lectures are alright. Not the most engaging, but not the least either. I'd say try to learn the material on your own because the class is really slow in comparison to literally any other intro CS course. The hardest part is probably knowing pseudocode for the tests. She does give extra credit through attendance, so try to be there.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Kendrick was personally one of my favorite teachers to have in the semester. Although the course was slightly underdeveloped, the whole department and the teacher did a good job in challenging the students and encouraging people to explore further into the programming field. The class should be an easy A as long as you do work and read zybooks

She seems like one of those teachers who pay more attention to the senior classes. If you take have her, don't skip class and be sure to turn in class activities with your name on it everytime. Do all the work and turn them in early, see her outside class, talk to her about any problems you'll have. Good luck.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Professor Kendrick was really a God-send. The course is tough, but she made it much more enjoyable! She wants to see her students succeed and answers as many questions as she can ASAP. Her positive emails and announcements were greatly appreciated and encouraging. Please take her if you can!
Amazing teacher. She has a positive attitude everytime you go into class. Shes very good at elaborating on topics if you don't understand something

She was so much fun and I am glad I got her. I knew nothing about programming before this class and I was afraid I would never be able to learn but she helped me learn all of it. She taught in a large class but she made sure everyone understood the material and posted her PowerPoints and links on D2L so that we could look at them later. Amazing!!
A very fun teacher. She makes sure every student understands the material, and shes always vibrant. She never has a bad day.
